page.title: 15THE COTTESMORE HUNT KENNELS
page.content: The Cottesmore Hunt Kennels were built in 1890.The red brick buildings comprise: 1.Stabling for 18 horses,and above the stables are flats for 4 grooms usually girls,and others are used for storage.The blacksmith's forge is still in use and a visiting blacksmith comes from Whissendine. 2.Kennels for the hounds with out- side runs.The dogs and bitches are kept apart.There are about 50-60 hounds at any one time,and there is a separate block for bitches and young puppies. 3.Dwellings-4-bedroomed house and garden and outbuildings for kennel huntsman.3-bedroomed house and garden for the kennelman.2-semi- detached cottages and gardens for assistants.
